thread.title: 'Beautiful' Venus shines brightly in the night sky ‚Äì the best photos
thread.title_full: 'Beautiful' Venus shines brightly in the night sky ‚Äì the best photos

author: Mark Molloy
title: 'Beautiful' Venus shines brightly in the night sky ‚Äì the best photos
text:
'Beautiful' Venus shines brightly in the night sky ‚Äì the best photos Venus and a crescent Moon are visible in the night sky Credit: Barcroft Mark Molloy 3 January 2017 ‚Ä¢ 9:28am 
S targazers looking up at the Moon last night may also have spotted a Venus visible to the naked eye shining brightly below it. 
Many social media users have shared photos of the second planet from the Sun in the night sky, with many confused amateur astronomers questioning exactly what planet was on show. A few people have asked me what the bright planet is below the moon tonight. It's Venus. Very beautiful. ‚Äî Brian Cox (@ProfBrianCox) January 2, 2017 
P rofessor Brian Cox tweeted: ‚ÄúA few people have asked me what the bright planet is below the Moon tonight. It's Venus. Very beautiful.‚Äù 
An incredibly clear night meant some were hopeful of also capturing a glimpse of Mars alongside Venus and the Moon. 
‚ÄúMars, the Moon and Venus are all in a line in tonight's sky. Looking awesome!!‚Äù wrote one Twitter user. Many shared photos on social media ‚Äî Christina McKelvie (@ChristinaSNP) January 2, 2017 @ProfBrianCox and finally some clear skies in the UK! :-) pic.twitter.com/qyO3ZFlkQo ‚Äî dave smith (@davegsmith34) January 2, 2017 @davegsmith34 I braved the cold and got this, thank you buddy :) pic.twitter.com/pwDYBzFF2v ‚Äî Stephen Hadley (@CNCste) January 2, 2017 @ProfBrianCox @IvorGCampbell I took a pic .. thought it might be Venus üòÄ pic.twitter.com/2bh340qF7J ‚Äî AKA Dave (@Dahmerscookpot) January 2, 2017 Another iPhone picture of the #Moon and Venus. I'd rather have a telescope! To also get a good view of Mars and Uranus. pic.twitter.com/aQ2g9w5RUp ‚Äî Terry Virts (@AstroTerry) January 3, 2017 Look at the crescent moon tonight! The planet Venus is to the bottom right and Mars is upper left. ‚Äî VirtualAstro (@VirtualAstro) January 2, 2017 
S ienna Hall wrote: ‚ÄúGot a shock when I looked out of window. Didn't expect to see Venus with the Moon in such a clear sky. 
Londoner Alec Taylor wrote: ‚ÄúAmazing to see Venus shining so brightly next to the Moon at the moment - what a new year's treat :)‚Äù A man takes photos of a crescent Moon and the bright planet Venus in sky in Yangzhou, east China's Jiangsu Province Credit: Barcroft 
W hile former Nasa astronaut Terry Virts shared a photo with the caption: ‚ÄúThe #Moon and Venus tonight. With a telescope and less clouds you would see #Mars and Neptune a little higher up, right next to each other 
‚ÄúI'd rather have a telescope! To also get a good view of Mars and Uranus.‚Äù Venus next to the Moon Credit: EPA 
A ccording to EarthSky , January will be a particularly good month to spot Venus once the sun has set, with the planet reaching its greatest elongation on January 12. Venus dazzles next to the Moon Credit: Barcroft 
S pace.com adds: ‚ÄúThis dazzling planet‚Äôs altitude a half hour after sunset increases from 30 to 36 degrees between New Year‚Äôs Day and month‚Äôs end. 
‚ÄúVenus is stunning throughout January as the planet brightens from magnitude minus 4.3 to minus 4.6, remaining up for almost 4 hours after sunset.‚Äù
